shapes

Class Direction

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes.Direction

  • public class Direction
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a direction in the 2D plane. Directions can be used to control which way shapes face and which way they move.

    Directions are represented in degrees (or radians) starting with 0 degrees pointing to the right, and increasing counterclockwise (like in a unit circle). For example, up is 90 degrees and left is 180 degrees.

      static Direction UP
      A direction pointing upward (90 degrees).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Direction

        public Direction(double degrees)
        Constructs a new direction pointing a given number of degrees counterclockwise from straight right. So, for example, 0 degrees points right, 90 degrees points up, and 180 degrees points left.
        Parameters:
        degrees - the number of degrees counterclockwise from straight right this direction will point.

      • Direction

        public Direction(Point start,
         Point finish)
        Constructs a new direction pointing from one point to another. The constructed direction is the direction one would have to move to get from start to finish.
        Parameters:
        start - where this direction starts.
        finish - where this direction ends.

    • Method Detail

      • inRadians

        public static Direction inRadians(double radians)
        Returns a new direction pointing a given number of radians counterclockwise from straight right. So, for example, 0 radians points right, Math.PI / 2.0 points up, and Math.PI points up.
        Parameters:
        radians - the number of radians counterclockwise from straight right the returned direction will point.
        Returns:
        a new direction pointing in the specified direction.

      • inDegrees

        public static Direction inDegrees(double degrees)
        Constructs a new direction pointing a given number of degrees counterclockwise from straight right. So, for example, 0 degrees points right, 90 degrees points up, and 180 degrees points left. (This method is basically identical to new Direction(degrees).)
        Parameters:
        degrees - the number of degrees counterclockwise from straight right the returned direction will point.
        Returns:
        a new direction pointing in the specified direction.

      • toRadians

        public double toRadians()
        Return the number of radians this direction is from straight right when rotated counterclockwise. So, for example, if this direction points right, this method returns 0, and if this direction points up it returns Math.PI / 2.0.
        Returns:
        double radians counterclockwise from straight right this direction points.

      • toDegrees

        public double toDegrees()
        Return the number of degrees this direction is from straight right when rotated counterclockwise. So, for example, if this direction points right, this method returns 0, and if this direction points up it returns 90.
        Returns:
        double degrees counterclockwise from straight right this direction points.

      • reverse

        public Direction reverse()
        Returns the opposite direction. So, for example, if this direction points up, the returned direction will point down.
        Returns:
        the opposite direction.

      • perpendicular

        public Direction perpendicular()
        Returns a direction perpendicular to this one. Note that each direction in 2 dimensions has two perpendicular directions. This method returns the perpendicular direction that is a 90 degree counterclockwise rotation of this direction.

        To get both perpendicular directions, use direction.perpendicular() and direction.perpendicular().reverse().

        Returns:
        a direction perpendicular to this one.

      • rotationByRadians

        public Direction rotationByRadians(double radians)
        Returns a direction a given number of radians counterclockwise from this direction.
        Parameters:
        radians - the measure of the angle in radians between this direction and the returned direction.
        Returns:
        the direction radians radians counterclockwise from this direction.

      • rotationByDegrees

        public Direction rotationByDegrees(double degrees)
        Returns a direction a given number of degrees counterclockwise from this direction. (This method is identical to rotation(double).)
        Parameters:
        degrees - the measure of the angle in degrees between this direction and the returned direction.
        Returns:
        the direction degrees degrees counterclockwise from this direction.

      • rotation

        public Direction rotation(double degrees)
        Returns a direction a given number of degrees counterclockwise from this direction.
        Parameters:
        degrees - the measure of the angle in degrees between this direction and the returned direction.
        Returns:
        the direction degrees degrees counterclockwise from this direction.

      • random

        public static Direction random()
        Returns a random direction. All directions are equally likely.
        Returns:
        a random direction.

      • isRightward

        public boolean isRightward()
        Return whether this direction is more rightward than leftward.
        Returns:
        true if this direction is within a quarter revolution of straight right, false if not.

      • isUpward

        public boolean isUpward()
        Return whether this direction is more upward than downward.
        Returns:
        true if this direction is within a quarter revolution of straight up, false if not.

      • isLeftward

        public boolean isLeftward()
        Return whether this direction is more leftward than rightward.
        Returns:
        true if this direction is within a quarter revolution of straight left, false if not.

      • isDownward

        public boolean isDownward()
        Return whether this direction is more downward than upward.
        Returns:
        true if this direction is within a quarter revolution of straight down, false if not.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Return whether this direction is equal to another object.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the object with which to compare this direction.
        Returns:
        true if obj is a Direction object and it points in the same direction as this one (within a very small tolerance).

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this direction.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of this direction.
